definition: thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound

sentences.english: He burst into the room red-faced and out of breath .
sentences.chinese: 他冲进房间，脸色通红，气喘吁吁。

sentences.english: Security officials rushed down the main aisle to detain the woman.
sentences.chinese: 安全官员立马冲进主通道，扣留了该名女子。

sentences.english: Then he rushed into Mr Sun's kitchen to save her.
sentences.chinese: 然后他冲进孙奶奶家的厨房去救她。

sentences.english: Panicked, Laura dashed into the house, grabbed the phone and dialed the emergency number.
sentences.chinese: 劳娜惊慌地冲进屋里，抓起电话，拨号报警。

sentences.english: Vernon charges in, stands looking blinded, like an enraged bull.
sentences.chinese: 弗农冲进来站住，两眼发直，像一头激怒了的公牛。

sentences.english: Fight the rapids as you kayak and raft down the vast Mekong River.
sentences.chinese: 当你的皮船和木筏冲进湄公河时和急流的艰险战斗。

sentences.english: How many years can a mountain exist Before it is washed to the sea?
sentences.chinese: 一座山要生存多少年才能被冲进海洋？

sentences.english: He dashed into the inner office. He charged upon the desk of the stenographer.
sentences.chinese: 他箭步冲进里间办公室，向速记员的办公桌冲过去。

sentences.english: The hospital chief executive said the attackers just barged in and fired indiscriminately.
sentences.chinese: 这家医院院长表示，袭击者冲进来，乱枪扫射。

sentences.english: They hammered in the door and then charged into the room.
sentences.chinese: 他们撞开了门冲进房间。

sentences.english: Soon they engaged in a fight. Security guards rushed in and took them aside.
sentences.chinese: 很快两就动起手来，保安冲进来把他们拉到一边。

sentences.english: And he watches in horror as his car goes over a cliff.
sentences.chinese: 他惊骇地看着他的车冲进了悬崖。

sentences.english: The mother set the baby against the sofa and rushed to the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 母亲把小孩靠沙发放好，冲进厨房。

sentences.english: How many years must a mountain exist Before it is washed to the sea?
sentences.chinese: 一座山要生存多少年才能被冲进海洋？

sentences.english: The rest of the group piled in to see what was going on.
sentences.chinese: 队里的其他人都冲进去看发生了什么事。

sentences.english: Before the meal is over, the cat rushes into the room and jumps up into her chair quickly.
sentences.chinese: 正在快吃完时，小猫缓慢天冲进房子跳上本人的椅子。

definition: to get into/to dig into (studies, job etc)/to squeeze into
to go straight to/to make a beeline for
to spill/to overflow (of water, crowds)/to crowd (into a space)
to rush out through a door (idiom)
